channel.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch
channel.description:
[youtube.com/watch?v=72Swb7dKWiM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72Swb7dKWiM)
[youtube.com/watch?v=HjRpKU0tvNY](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HjRpKU0tvNY)
Here are the things I've noticed so far:
1. The crowbar collision detection seems weird. Face any given wall and swing the crowbar. Now turn to the left or right and keep swinging. Eventually you will start hitting the wall away from the crosshair. In fact, at one point there was a wall close behind me and I could hear my crowbar hitting the wall behind me and to the right.
2. Tripmines do no damage if you pass through the laser against the opposite wall. Seems a little... underpowered.
3. No sound effects play when you first pick up the MP5.
4. The MP5 firing sound effect and muzzle flash are both somewhat underwhelming.
5. The menu screens (such as options menu) are transparent and I feel that it would look much better if they were opaque.
6. The workshop mod that alters the grunt's voices really improves the atmosphere.

item.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch
item.dc:creator: Dragunov2
item.description:
Patience my young Padawan…

They gonna address it once the time has come

Read full topic

item.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch
item.dc:creator: lukeman3000
item.description:
Well, I saw there was a patch posted a couple days ago and was disappointed to see neither of these things addressed.

I’m sure there are many, many other issues but these seem relatively glaring to me. Especially the fact that the trip mines are so weak. Shouldn’t that be a simple adjustment of a couple variables to improve their damage/blast radius?

Read full topic

item.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch
item.dc:creator: sourcegamer101
item.description:
tripmines are hilariously weak, they either need a larger blast radius or less damage falloff, or maybe even both

cause as it stands, there’s no consequence for tripping them (unless you are in the maze in ST)

Read full topic

item.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Ah, good, so it’s not me.

Crypt:

I’ll post this here because I’m not sure if it’s a bug or I just (somehow) broke something.
Is this normal behavior?

youtu.be/-Al2M-nBDbE

I noticed it both on official SP maps as well as custom ones. Player-placed mines work as usual.

Read full topic

item.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch

item.description:
If it’s posted here, the developers will see it.

Read full topic

item.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch
item.dc:creator: lukeman3000
item.description:
50 views and no replies? Has anyone else experienced or noticed these things or am I crazy?

Or have they all already been reported?

Read full topic

item.title: Crowbar and Tripmine glitch
item.dc:creator: lukeman3000
item.description:
youtube.com/watch?v=72Swb7dKWiM

youtube.com/watch?v=HjRpKU0tvNY

Here are the things I’ve noticed so far:

  1. The crowbar collision detection seems weird. Face any given wall and swing the crowbar. Now turn to the left or right and keep swinging. Eventually you will start hitting the wall away from the crosshair. In fact, at one point there was a wall close behind me and I could hear my crowbar hitting the wall behind me and to the right.

  2. Tripmines do no damage if you pass through the laser against the opposite wall. Seems a little… underpowered.

  3. No sound effects play when you first pick up the MP5.

  4. The MP5 firing sound effect and muzzle flash are both somewhat underwhelming.

  5. The menu screens (such as options menu) are transparent and I feel that it would look much better if they were opaque.

  6. The workshop mod that alters the grunt’s voices really improves the atmosphere.
